title: html, original & simple, and plain text not easily acessed.
creator: condobloke1
content:
html used to be easily accessed on the page of the individual emails. (see screenshot of it missing)

i have a need for it on an ongoing basis.

Can I make its accessibility just as simple/easy, without going to back to another release?

Linux Mint Cinnamon 22.3.

Thunderbird 140.7.0esr (64-bit)

Brian

title: Link Previews image size
creator: john273
content:
When adding a link in the composer I get a large image.

I have tried to adjust the page code to give me a more suitable size however it seems the TB overrides the size

My page code reads <meta property="og:title" content="It's complex from 1948 to 2023"> 

   <meta property="og:description" content="#672">    <meta property="og:type" content="article">    <meta property="og:image:alt" content="#672">    <meta property="og:image" content="https://traumainreligion.com/images/faqyme_256-134.png">     <meta property="og:image:type" content="image/png">    <meta property="og:image:width" content="256">     <meta property="og:image:height" content="134">

title: gmail
creator: airbus
content: hello, In Gmail, when I delete an email, it comes back to the inbox after 10 seconds. I’m tired of this bug — it’s been happening for a year.

title: Thunderbird Android to Desktop
creator: firefox2351
content:
Hello

I have Thunderbird set up on my Android phone and I’d like to transfer the settings to my desktop (Linux Mint) Thunderbird.

The only export option that I can find on Android produces a .k9s file but I can’t find any way to load that in to Thunderbird desktop (although it worked great going from Android to Android).

There seems to be plenty of Help to go from Desktop to Android but nothing about going the other way.

There’s always the option to enter the IMAP ans SMTP settings manually but, surely, there’s a better way?

Mike
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Linux Mint

title: Fonts in Thunderbird

content: What font can used in Thunderbird that will display a capital I with top and bottom bars? Otherwise it's impossible to determine whether the letter is an capital i or the letter L.

title: cartelle mancanti e local folders
creator: nat.io
content: Buongiorno, a causa del crash di una partizione contenente win7 64, ho dovuto reinstallare tutto. Utilizzo win 7, perchè ho installato programmi che funzionano solo su di lui. Installando Thunderbird sono partito dalla ver. 62 facendo gli aggiornamenti fino alla 115, che prima del crash funzionava ottimamente. Installato tutti gli accounts (2 alice, 3 tim, 1 tiscali, 2 gmail) tutti hanno solo posta in arrivo e cestino, tranne un gmail che è completo. Connesso local folders ad un partizione del disco contenente il vecchio local folder viene caricato normalmente, ma tutte le cartelle carica risultano vuote. Potete aiutarmi?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0;os:Win 7 64 bit, aggiornato completamente tramite windows upgrade

title: mancato invio della posta
creator: ermanno.piccolo
content:
messaggio ricevuto con invio: Invio del messaggio non riuscito. L’autorità emittente del certificato del peer non è stata riconosciuta. La configurazione relativa a smtps.tin.it deve essere corretta.

come la correggo?
